summary: This New York Post article discusses Jeffrey Epstein's controversial financial background and high-society lifestyle, including his connections to notable figures like President Clinton and Kevin Spacey. It highlights Epstein's past work with Steve Hoffenberg and mentions various lawsuits against him, including one from Citibank for loan defaults.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is described as a self-proclaimed billionaire with a questionable financial background.
Epstein has been involved in numerous lawsuits, including one from Citibank for defaulting on $20 million in loans.
Steve Hoffenberg, Epstein's mentor, is currently serving a 20-year prison sentence for running a Ponzi scheme.
Epstein is noted for flying high-profile individuals like Bill Clinton and Kevin Spacey on his private jet.
Leslie Wexner, a retail magnate, is one of the few clients of Epstein who is publicly acknowledged.
